title: Saudi Aramco's IPO Prospectus Doesn't Reveal How Much It Plans to Sell
summary: Oil giant releases preliminary prospectus, but key details that investors are focused on were missing. Saudi Arabia moved a step closer toward listing its national oil giant Aramco on its domestic exchange, releasing the preliminary prospectus late Saturday for what is slated to be the world's largest initial public offering.

title: Trump Says He May Release Transcript of Earlier Ukraine Call
summary: Meanwhile, House Republicans have asked to call Hunter Biden, anonymous whistleblower to testify publicly. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he is likely to release the full transcript of his April telephone conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Tuesday, a day before public impeachment hearings are set to begin in the U.S. House.

title: Aramco Promises Bumper Dividends but Investors Dwell on Governance and Valuation
summary: The state oil giant has initially pledged an annual dividend of $75 billion for the first five years. As Saudi Aramco gears up for what could be the world's largest ever share sale, the company is trying to draw global investors with the promise of hefty dividends. But some investors are dwelling instead on what they perceive to be weak governance and a potentially high valuation.

title: India's Top Court Rules in Favor of Hindus in a Long Feud With Muslims
summary: The decision over the control of a patch of land in Ayodhya will help shape India's political and social landscape. NEW DELHI-India's Supreme Court, ruling on one of the country's most divisive cases, paved the way for Hindu groups to build a temple on a religious site contested by Muslim groups seeking to rebuild a mosque that once stood in the same location.

title: Top Prospects Get Caught in NCAA Crosshairs
summary: The eligibility of Ohio State defensive end Chase Young and Memphis basketball star James Wiseman are called into question amid alleged rules violations. It was a bad day to be a prospective No. 1 draft pick in college sports. Within the span of several hours on Friday, the NCAA ruled the possible top picks in the next NFL and NBA drafts ineligible because of alleged rules violations.

title: Parents' Major Hang-Up: Kids on Smartphones
summary: Nationwide movement says 'wait until eighth grade'. In a crusade against the dark side of technology, thousands of parents in the New York area have pledged mutual support in just saying no to smartphones for their children until at least eighth grade.

title: Ferrari CEO Races to Build Company's Brand
summary: Louis Camilleri, in his first interview since taking over, talks about the Formula 1 team, electric vehicles, and being a luxury marque. MARANELLO, Italy-Louis Camilleri's appointment as Ferrari NV's chief executive in July last year surprised many, including himself. Fifteen months on, his imprint on the Italian luxury sports car maker is becoming evident.

title: Details Aside, Warren Supporters Just Want Plans
summary: Many Democrats aren't immersed in the meat of her proposals but drawn to her vision for governing. Aria Neukam says she loves that Democratic presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren has lots of plans. She knows the senator has an education plan, a Medicare for All plan, an environmental plan.

title: Cash-Strapped Small Businesses Turn to GoFundMe
summary: Resume Subscription. Aimee Skier loves taking her 3-year-old son to story time at Books of Wonder in Manhattan. So when she got an email from the bookstore soliciting GoFundMe donations to help with moving costs, she was happy to chip in $25.

title: Activision Is Getting Its Game Back
summary: Strong 'Call of Duty' launch and new Blizzard pipeline improve game publisher's outlook. It has been a rough year for Activision Blizzard . But in the videogame world, fates can often turn on a dime.

title: Trump Impeachment Inquiry Delves into Idea of Quid Pro Quo
summary: Federal courts and prosecutors have had trouble pinning down just when a quid pro quo is inappropriate. At the heart of the House impeachment inquiry into President Trump's Ukraine dealings is a Latin term that is easy to translate but legally difficult to define and prove.

title: Brexit 'Paralysis' Leads Moody's to Lower Outlook on U.K. Debt
summary: The ratings company cited little prospect for reduction in government spending, though investors remain sanguine, with U.K. interest rates not far from record lows. LONDON-Moody's Investors Service lowered its outlook on the U.K.'s debt rating, saying the country's handling of Brexit has shown its once robust public institutions are at risk of losing their predictability and cohesiveness.

title: Defending Trump: The Republican Playbook
summary: The president's allies have deployed at least six arguments to dismiss or play down the allegations against him. Republicans have run the gamut in their defense of President Trump's interactions with Ukraine in recent days, as the public hearings in the House impeachment inquiry loom: There was no quid pro quo. Or if there was, it wasn't illegal or even improper. And because Ukraine ultimately received aid and its president met Mr. Trump without opening investigations, no favors were traded.

title: Hong Kong Arrests Pro-Democracy Lawmakers Ahead of Local Elections
summary: Some lawmakers accuse authorities of trying to create fear and chaos to postpone the poll, as antigovernment protests stretch on. Seven Hong Kong pro-democracy lawmakers were either arrested or received notice of pending arrest in an action criticized as a government clampdown on the opposition ahead of local elections scheduled later this month.

title: Democrats Savor a Good Week, With 2020 in Mind
summary: Political picture remains fluid, however, with Democrats divided on how to capitalize on their chances. Democrats this week peered into 2020 through the lens of Virginia and Kentucky and liked what they saw.

summary: Resume Subscription. John Schricker took out a loan to buy a car in 2017. Then he took out another. And then another.

title: China's Consumer Inflation Soars to Highest Level in Years
summary: Consumer-price index rose 3.8% in October, fueled by surge in hog prices. BEIJING-A doubling of pork prices last month sent Chinese consumer inflation to its highest level in nearly eight years, constraining Beijing's ability to stimulate the economy as growth continues to slow.

title: Deadly Wildfires Ravage Australia's East Coast
summary: About 1,500 firefighters were battling 70 fires across New South Wales. CANBERRA, Australia-Wildfires ravaging Australia's drought-stricken east coast have left at least three people dead, several missing and dozens injured, with more than 150 homes destroyed, officials said Saturday.

title: Trump Administration Proposes Increasing Fee for U.S. Citizenship Application
summary: Proposal calls for new fees for asylum applications, DACA renewals; 'this is a wealth tax on becoming a U.S. citizen,' a critic says. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration is proposing to raise the cost of applying for U.S. citizenship, as well as creating new fees for some asylum seekers and the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program.

title: PG&E Plan to Pay Insurance Claims in Cash Hurts Bankruptcy Talks
summary: An $11 billion cash payout would push victims to take stock deal. An $11 billion settlement of insurance claims tied to PG&E Corp.'s alleged responsibility for California wildfires is emerging as an impediment to a potentially broader deal to end the utility's bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Investigators Find Clue to Vaping Injuries
summary: Vitamin E oil was detected in all 29 samples taken from vaping patients tested by the CDC. Vitamin E oil was detected in all 29 samples taken from vaping patients tested by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the federal agency said Friday, a tantalizing clue in the investigation into the cause of mysterious lung injuries.

title: Catalan Unrest Dims Spanish Socialists' Hopes for Big Election Win
summary: Right-leaning parties benefit from aggressive line against secession, raising likelihood of another fragmented parliament. VALENCIA, Spain-Leaders of Spain's far-right Vox party took the stage during a campaign rally in this coastal city and inveighed against Catalan separatism, prompting roars of support from the crowd of thousands waving red-and-yellow Spanish flags.
